intro: Lobelia portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and stream banks. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
